page.title: 09LADDINGFORD VILLAGE
page.content: A LOT OF THE APPLE ORCHARDS ON THE NEARBY FARMS HAVE BEEN TAKEN AWAY FOR CEREALS AND CROPS LIKE BEANS,PEAS,POTATOES,BARLEY-GRASS FOR GRAZING HORSES,RASPBERRIES AND VEGETABLES.AT EMMETT HILL THERE WAS A BRICK-WORKS BUT NOW IT IS A POND WHICH HAS A LOT OF BIRDS DURING THE YEAR. A TRANSPORT DEPOT HAS VERY RECENTLY BEEN SOLD FOR A NEW HOUSING DEVELOPMENT.WE SAW VERY FEW PEOPLE AT WORK ON THE FARMS. A FEW HOUSES ARE LIVED IN BY PEOPLE WHO WORK ON THE FARMS BUT BARNS,OASTS AND FARM WORKERS COTTAGES HAVE BEEN CONVERTED TO FAMILY HOMES, WHERE THE FATHER COMMUTES TO LONDON OR MAIDSTONE. PEOPLE DO NOT SEEM TO OBJECT TO THE CHANGES TO THE FARMS SO LONG AS THEY KEEP A SIMILAR APPEARANCE.
